alert.note: Alert for Central and West Carbon (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued September 27 at 2:29AM MDT until September 27 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 422... The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from noon today to 7 PM MDT this evening. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire weather zone 422. * WIND...Southwest 15 to 25 MPH with gusts up to 35 MPH * HUMIDITY...As low as 10 to 15 percent. * IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
